JUDGES: András Sajó;Anatoly Kovler;Antonella Mularoni;Françoise Tulkens;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born on DATE in the village of ORG in GPE and is currently serving his sentence in the GPE region . He is represented before the ORG by Mr I. Timishev , a lawyer practising in GPE , GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were initially represented by PERSON , the former Representative of GPE at ORG , and subsequently by their Representative , PERSON .

The applicant was one of the applicants in the ORG case ( ORG and Others v. GPE and GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , ORG CARDINALIII ) . In his letter of DATE he requested that the present application be joined to his complaint in the ORG case , cited above . On DATE , in view of the fact that judgment had already been given in GPE , cited above , and that the complaints made by the applicant in the present case differed to a large extent from those raised by his NORP representatives in GPE , the ORG decided not to join the CARDINAL cases under Rule CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the Rules of Court .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE a group of several armed men , including the applicant , were arrested by the NORP border guards on the NORP border ( see ORG and Others , cited above , § § DATE and CARDINAL ) .

The applicant was placed in pre - trial detention by the NORP authorities . Following that measure , ORG requested the applicant ’s extradition to GPE ( see GPE and Others , cited above , § § DATE ) . The applicant was charged by the NORP authorities with terrorism and banditry with aggravating circumstances ( Articles CARDINAL § CARDINAL and CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW ) ; causing bodily harm to members of the police and security forces ( LAW ) ; organising illegal armed groups and participation in such groups , with aggravating circumstances ( LAW ) ; gunrunning with aggravating circumstances ( LAW CARDINAL of LAW ) ; and illegal crossing of GPE border in DATE , with aggravating circumstances ( Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the Code ) . He was extradited on DATE ( see ORG and Others , cited above , § § CARDINAL , DATE , DATE and DATE ) .

It appears that upon the applicant ’s arrival in GPE , on DATE , he was assigned a lawyer to represent his interests , Mr PERSON . After DATE the applicant was defended by another lawyer , hired by his family , PERSON On DATE the applicant instructed Mr Timishev to represent him before ORG .

The applicant produced a letter dated DATE which had been sent to the ORG on DATE by PERSON in connection with the ORG case ( see ORG and Others , cited above , § CARDINAL ) . In the letter , sent in relation to a request from ORG to the ORG , Mr PERSON stated that he had acted as PERSON ORG ’s defence lawyer DATE and DATE in connection with the criminal charges brought against the latter . During that period his former client had never complained of a violation of his rights under the Convention , nor had he ever expressed to him a wish to apply to the ORG . In the absence of relevant instructions from the applicant , the lawyer could not contact the ORG on his own initiative . He had always had adequate time and facilities to prepare his client ’s defence and opportunities to meet him without prison wardens being present ( ibid . , § § CARDINAL et seq . ) .

The applicant alleged that PERSON PERSON had taken no steps to defend him . In any event , since he did not speak LANGUAGE , the lawyer would have been unable to hold discussions with him . He had not refused to accept Mr ORG services ; nor had he lodged any complaints against the actions of Mr PERSON with the domestic courts or any other authorities .

On DATE the preliminary investigation was closed . The applicant was committed for trial before ORG of GPE ( “ ORG of Chechnya ” ) . On DATE , citing the “ lack of judges of the court available to examine this category of case ” , the President of that court decided to refer the case to ORG of GPE so that the latter could designate another competent court .
On DATE the Vice - President of ORG of GPE decided to refer the case to ORG .

When he was brought before ORG , the applicant requested that his case be transferred to ORG LAW of LAW ( “ ORG ” ) . He insisted that , under the ORG , his case fell within the territorial jurisdiction of that court .

By a decision of DATE a single judge of ORG rejected the request on the ground that LAW ORG prohibited jurisdiction disputes between courts . As the case had been referred to ORG by ORG of GPE following a decision to transfer jurisdiction , the applicant ’s request could not be granted .

The applicant lodged an application for supervisory review with ORG of GPE . On DATE a judge of that court replied to the applicant , pointing out that decisions of the President and ORG of ORG of GPE were not amenable to appeal and that , accordingly , his complaint concerning the transfer of jurisdiction had been rejected without being examined on the merits .

According to the judge in question , when the preliminary investigation was closed on DATE the applicant had requested a jury trial before ORG see LAW ( b ) of the ORG ) . As assize courts could not be introduced in GPE until DATE ( as provided by the federal PERSON of DATE ) , the fact that the applicant ’s case had been referred to ORG of GPE with a view to transferring jurisdiction was not contrary to LAW ORG . The judge maintained that since the applicant and his representative had been informed of the decision of DATE to refer the case to ORG for examination , there had been no violation of the applicant ’s rights .

After the communication of the case to the NORP authorities , the parties informed the ORG that on DATE the applicant and his representative had stated that he did not want to be tried by jury . Accordingly , the case was to be heard by a single judge . Following several decisions to adjourn the hearing , on CARDINAL DATE ORG granted the applicant ’s request and decided to refer the question of territorial jurisdiction to ORG .
On DATE ORG ruled that the case was to be heard by ORG , in view of the applicant ’s withdrawal of his request to be tried by jury .

On DATE ORG found the applicant guilty of banditry , illegal handling of firearms , assault on police or military officers and illegal crossing of the state border . The applicant was given a custodial sentence of DATE , to be served in a strict - regime correctional facility . On DATE the applicant appealed against the conviction , apparently raising a number of procedural irregularities and questioning the interpretation of certain facts by the trial court . He did not submit a copy of his appeal .
On DATE ORG upheld the conviction .

Alleging that while being transferred from the GPE to ORG on DATE his client had been ill - treated by the guards escorting him , Mr PERSON applied to the PERSON district prosecutor ’s office to have the perpetrators placed under investigation .

The prosecutor of the GPE district of GPE investigated the complaint . The prosecutor questioned the applicant , several guards who had been on duty on DATE and the GPE officers who had dealt with the applicant ’s reception after he had been delivered into their custody after the court hearing . The prosecutor also inspected the journal of medical complaints kept in the GPE . In his statement given to the prosecutor on DATE the applicant stated that the guards had pushed him when he was climbing into the car and then slapped him on the back CARDINAL times . They had also pushed him in the back on arrival at the court building , forcing him to walk faster .

By a decision of DATE , the application was rejected on the ground that no confirmation of the applicant ’s allegations had been established and that the latter had not requested any medical assistance in relation to the incident . The applicant did not appeal against that decision .

In addition , an internal inquiry was carried out by ORG of the ORG . In those proceedings the guards in question were identified and questioned . They denied ill - treating the applicant . No complaints from or injuries to the applicant had been registered . ORG concluded that the complaint was unsubstantiated .
Since DATE matters relating to criminal procedure have been governed by LAW ORG ) of GPE ( Law no . CARDINAL of DATE ) .

LAW ORG sets out the composition of trial courts . Part CARDINAL ( b ) of that LAW provides that , upon an application by the accused , the trial of serious crimes can be conducted by a bench composed of one federal judge and CARDINAL jurors .

Articles CARDINAL , DATE and Article CARDINAL of the ORG lay down rules of territorial jurisdiction . They stipulate that if , inter alia , upon a successful application of a party to the proceedings , a decision has been taken to transfer the case to another court , that decision is final and binding on the court to which the case has been transferred .

The federal PERSON of DATE amended the order of entry into force of the provisions of the ORG . In particular , in so far as it concerned the introduction of jury trial , the PERSON provided that LAW part CARDINAL ( b ) of the ORG would come into force in the PERSON region as of DATE and in GPE as of DATE .
